title: Private Component Codegen
description: Code generator based on private components
guides: Generate a Table component, include 3 columns: name, age, address

rules.description: Define the rules for generating styles
Define the file structure for the project
Attention rules for the code generator

rules.description: Define which private components to use

das-action-more.purpose: Dropdown menu for secondary actions to save space
das-action-more.usage: Collapse multiple action buttons into a dropdown
tips: Use unique keys for each item
Mark dangerous actions with danger:true
Group related actions with dividers
Keep frequently used actions outside dropdown

das-alert.purpose: Alert component for displaying system messages and notifications
das-alert.example:
<das-alert message="Operation successful" type="success" />
<das-alert message="Information tip" type="info" />
<das-alert message="Warning message" type="warning" />
<das-alert message="Error message" type="error" />

api.type: string - Alert type: success|info|warning|error|common, default common
api.title: string - Title (banner mode)
api.closable: boolean - Show close button, default true

types.AlertData: { title: string, message: string, type: string, expand: boolean, maxLineNumber: number }

notes.persistence: Remain visible until issue is resolved

api.list: Array - Options list passed to component, default options
api.attrKey: Function - Value attribute accessor, default (item) => item.value
api.attrLabel: Function - Label attribute accessor, default (item) => item.label
api.isMultipleAll: boolean - Enable select all in multi-select mode, default true
api.isAutoResize: boolean - Auto resize tag display based on dropdown size, default true

slots.moreTagList: Hidden data list for tooltip display, recommend virtual list (hideData)

notes.performance: Use virtual list in moreTagList slot when selected data is excessive
notes.responsive: Component auto-adapts tag display to container size for responsive layouts
notes.selectAll: Keep isMultipleAll enabled for better user experience with large datasets
notes.autoResize: Enable isAutoResize to dynamically truncate tag display in space-constrained scenarios

das-button-organizer.usage: Auto-collapse excess buttons into dropdown menu when space is limited
das-button-organizer.notes: Shows first N buttons directly, excess buttons collapse to dropdown. Supports disable rules and custom styling.

das-carousel.usage: Scrolling carousel for text, images, or other content with customizable speed and container size

api.width: number, default: 400 - Container width in pixels
api.height: number, default: 50 - Container height in pixels

slots.default: Scrolling content (text, images, or other elements)

das-carousel.notes: Seamless infinite scrolling with auto-adapting content. Supports text, images, and custom elements. Consider performance for complex content.

das-columns-setting.purpose: Table column visibility control component with dropdown selection and dynamic toggling

basic.code:
<template>
  <DasColumnsSetting v-model="selectedColumns" :columns="columnConfig" />
</template>

<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue'

const columnConfig = [
  { name: 'Task Name', value: 'taskName', show: 'all' },
  { name: 'Template', value: 'template', show: 'all' },
  { name: 'Data Source', value: 'dataSource', show: 'all' },
  { name: 'Host', value: 'host', show: undefined },
  { name: 'Asset Stats', value: 'assetStats', show: 'dataTagging' },
  { name: 'Cycle', value: 'cycle', show: false },
  { name: 'Actions', value: 'actions', show: 'all' }
]

const selectedColumns = ref(['taskName', 'template', 'host', 'actions'])
</script>

notes: Built on ant-design-vue Dropdown and Checkbox

das-count-to.purpose: Number scrolling animation component for enhanced data visualization
das-count-to.usage: Data dashboards, real-time metrics, and dynamic statistics display

basic.desc: Number scrolls from 0 to target value with customizable styles and formatting

tips: Use decimal to control number precision
Adjust duration for optimal scroll experience
Separator improves large number readability
Prefix/suffix support slot customization
Perfect for dashboards and real-time monitoring

das-detail.purpose: Display structured detail information with multi-level data support
das-detail.usage: Show user profiles, order details, system configurations in organized layouts

basic.desc: Multi-level detail display with custom slots
basic.code:
<das-detail type="card" title="Â§öÁ∫ßÊ†áÈ¢ò" :items="items" :multiple="true" :detail-data="data" :column="2">
  <template #label_custom="{ item }">{{ item.label }} <QuestionCircleOutlined /></template>
  <template #content_custom="{ data }"><Tag color="success">ÊµãËØï</Tag></template>
</das-detail>

props.title: string - Card title
props.multiple: boolean - Enable multi-level titles, default false
props.colon: boolean - Show colon after label, default true

item-schema.title: string - Group title
item-schema.label: string - Item label
item-schema.expandRow: number - Default rows to show, default 4

slots.title: Custom card title
slots.label_[key]: Custom label content - scope: { item: DetailItem }
slots.content_[key]: Custom item content - scope: { item: DetailItem, data: Record<string,any> }

tips: Use 'card' type for better visual separation
Enable multiple for hierarchical data display
Customize labels and content with named slots
Set expandable for long text management

das-drawer.purpose: Slide-out panel for displaying additional content without leaving current page
das-drawer.usage: Show forms, details, settings, or supplementary information in overlay panels

basic.desc: Basic drawer with title and content

theme.code: Dark theme content

props.title: string - Drawer title
props.mask: boolean - Show mask overlay, default true
props.maskClosable: boolean - Close on mask click, default true
props.closable: boolean - Show close button, default true
props.outer: boolean - Outer drawer for nesting, default false

tips: Width property overrides size preset
Set outer=true for nested drawers
Minimum width is 480px regardless of size
Use zIndex to control stacking order
Size presets: large(80%), medium(60%), small(40%), mini(20%)

das-empty.purpose: Empty state component for displaying when no data is available
das-empty.usage: Data tables, search results, error pages, and initial states

basic.desc: Basic empty state with default configuration

sizes.desc: Three size variants for different contexts

types.desc: Predefined error and empty state types

custom.code:
<das-empty title="No Data" text="Click to create">
  <a-button type="primary">Create Now</a-button>
</das-empty>

props.title: string - Title text (hidden in small size), default 'ÊèêÁ§∫'

tips: Use large size for page-level empty states
Medium size for tables, drawers, and modals
Small size for cards and limited spaces
Title is hidden in small size mode
Choose appropriate type for context (search, charts, errors)
Add meaningful action buttons via default slot

das-form.purpose: Form component for collecting user input with validation and layout support
das-form.usage: Registration forms, configuration forms, data entry, and user input collection

basic.desc: Basic form with validation and various input types
basic.code:
<das-form :model="formState" :rules="rules" @finish="onFinish">
  <das-form-item label="Name" name="name" required>
    <a-input v-model:value="formState.name" />
  </das-form-item>
  <das-form-item label="Level" name="level">
    <a-radio-group v-model:value="formState.level">
      <a-radio value="high">High</a-radio>
      <a-radio value="medium">Medium</a-radio>
    </a-radio-group>
  </das-form-item>
  <das-form-item>
    <a-button type="primary" html-type="submit">Submit</a-button>
  </das-form-item>
</das-form>

group.desc: Form groups for organizing complex forms
group.code:
<das-form-group title="Basic Info" card>
  <das-form-item label="Name" name="name">
    <a-input v-model:value="formState.name" />
  </das-form-item>
</das-form-group>

props.colon: boolean - Show colon after label, default false
props.inlineLabelWidth: string - Inline layout label width, default '120px'
props.showAnchor: boolean - Show navigation anchors, default false

form-item.label: string|slot - Label text
form-item.name: string|number|array - Field name
form-item.col: number - Column span in inline layout, default 1
form-item.extraBordered: boolean - Show border for extra text, default false

form-group.title: string|slot - Group title
form-group.card: boolean - Use card style, default false
form-group.defaultExpanded: boolean - Default expanded state, default true

events.finish-failed: (error: {values, errorFields, outOfDate}) => void - Form submission failed
events.validate: (name: string, status: string, errorMsgs: string[]) => void - Field validation

methods.scrollToField: (name: string|number|array, options?: object) => void - Scroll to field

tips: Use inline layout for search forms, horizontal for edit forms, vertical for mobile
Group related fields with das-form-group for better organization
Set labelAlign to 'right' for consistent visual alignment
Use anchors for long forms with showAnchor and anchors props
Configure field dependencies with depends prop for conditional display
Use das-form-list for dynamic form arrays with min/max constraints

das-helper-text.purpose: Helper text component for displaying help information with different emphasis levels
das-helper-text.usage: Form field descriptions, operation instructions, and contextual help text

basic.desc: Three emphasis variants for different importance levels
basic.code:
<das-helper-text variant="strong">Important warning message</das-helper-text>
<das-helper-text variant="medium">Standard help information</das-helper-text>
<das-helper-text variant="weak">Supplementary note</das-helper-text>

form.desc: Form field help text with input guidance
form.code:
<a-form-item label="Email">
  <a-input v-model:value="email" />
  <das-helper-text variant="medium">
    Please enter a valid email address
  </das-helper-text>
</a-form-item>

rich.desc: Rich text content with HTML support
rich.code: See documentation for more details

tips: Use 'strong' for important warnings and critical information
Use 'medium' for standard help text and instructions
Use 'weak' for supplementary notes and optional information
Place below form fields for better user experience
Support HTML tags for rich content formatting

das-metric-card.purpose: Metric card component for displaying key data indicators with flexible layouts
das-metric-card.usage: Dashboard statistics, KPI displays, and data visualization cards

basic.desc: Basic metric card with title, value, and suffix

layout.desc: Different layout options for metric cards

custom.desc: Custom content with slots and styling

tips: Use for numerical data display with clear visual hierarchy
Choose appropriate type and color based on data importance
Vertical layout for more information, horizontal for compact display
Set footer, num, and total for progress bar functionality
Customize with slots for flexible content presentation

das-modal.purpose: Modal dialog component for important information display and user interactions
das-modal.usage: Confirmations, alerts, forms, and important information display

basic.desc: Basic modal with title and content

types.desc: Different modal types with status icons
types.code: Are you sure you want to delete?

props.title: string - Modal title
props.showCloseIcon: boolean - Show close button, default true
props.maskClosable: boolean - Close on mask click, default true

tips: Use for important information and user interactions
Keep content concise and avoid complex nested content
Use appropriate type for different scenarios (warning for deletions)
Ensure responsive design across different screen sizes
Consider form reset when closing modal with forms

das-popover.purpose: Popover component for displaying additional information and tooltips without interrupting user workflow
das-popover.usage: Quick information display, tooltips, confirmation dialogs, and contextual help

basic.code:
<das-popover title="Hover Trigger" content="Simple tooltip content" placement="top" trigger="hover">
  <a-button>Hover me</a-button>
</das-popover>

click.code: Click me

props.title: string - Popover title
props.closeable: boolean - Show close button, default false
props.autoClose: boolean - Auto close on outside click, default true
props.confirm: boolean - Show confirmation dialog, default false

tips: Use for valuable additional information, avoid obvious content
Keep content concise and avoid complex nested elements
Choose appropriate trigger: hover for info, click for actions
Ensure proper positioning across different screen sizes
Use confirmation mode for important operations
Maintain consistent theme with overall interface design
Consider max width/height for long content with scrolling if needed

das-select.purpose: Select component for choosing single or multiple options from a dropdown list
das-select.usage: Option selection, data filtering, form inputs, and categorized content selection

basic.desc: Basic select with search and clear functionality

props.allowClear: boolean - Show clear button, default false
props.showSearch: boolean - Enable search in single mode, default false
props.isTree: boolean - Tree select mode, default false
props.options: Array<{value, label, disabled?, desc?}> - Options data, default []
props.treeData: Array<{key, title, disabled?, children?}> - Tree data, default []
props.isDropdownSearch: boolean - Show search in dropdown, default false
props.quickSelect: boolean - Show select all button, default false
props.virtual: boolean - Enable virtual scrolling, default true
props.isDropdownResize: boolean - Allow dropdown resize, default false
props.renderList: boolean - Adaptive item rendering, default false
props.descVertical: boolean - Vertical description layout, default false

slots.removeIcon: Custom remove icon for multiple mode

tips: Provide clear option labels to avoid user confusion
Enable virtual scrolling for large datasets to improve performance
Set reasonable max selection count in multiple mode
Keep tree hierarchy within 3-4 levels for better usability
Support fuzzy search to improve user efficiency
Use concise group titles for grouped options
Ensure disabled options have clear visual distinction
Set appropriate width based on option content length
Consider touch interaction for mobile usage
Provide confirmation for important selections

das-simple-chart.purpose: Simple chart component based on ECharts for data visualization
das-simple-chart.usage: Data presentation, statistical analysis, monitoring dashboards, and trend visualization

line.code:
<das-simple-chart :need-resize="true" :option="lineChartOption" width="100%" height="300px" />

const lineChartOption = {
  tooltip: { trigger: 'axis' },
  xAxis: { type: 'category', data: ['Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat', 'Sun'] },
  yAxis: { type: 'value' },
  series: [{ data: [820, 932, 901, 934, 1290, 1330, 1320], type: 'line', smooth: true }]
};

bar.code:
<das-simple-chart :option="barChartOption" width="100%" height="300px" />

const barChartOption = {
  xAxis: { type: 'category', data: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D'] },
  yAxis: { type: 'value' },
  series: [{ data: [120, 200, 150, 80], type: 'bar' }]
};

pie.code:
<das-simple-chart :option="pieChartOption" width="100%" height="300px" />

const pieChartOption = {
  series: [{ type: 'pie', data: [{ value: 335, name: 'A' }, { value: 310, name: 'B' }] }]
};

props.needResize: boolean - Auto resize on container change, default true

methods.setOption: (option: object, notMerge?: boolean) => void - Update chart configuration

tips: Component is based on ECharts library
Follow ECharts configuration standards for option prop
Set explicit width and height to avoid display issues
Enable needResize for responsive layouts
Use data sampling for large datasets to improve performance
Maintain consistent colors and themes with overall design
Consider touch interaction for mobile usage
Extract complex configurations to separate files
Use setOption method instead of directly modifying option object
ECharts instance is automatically disposed on component destruction

das-sql-tip-tree.purpose: Visual SQL query builder with AIQL syntax support for dynamic condition combination
das-sql-tip-tree.usage: Data query, condition filtering, report generation, and complex data screening scenarios

basic.desc: Basic SQL query builder with field configuration and syntax hints
basic.code:
<das-sql-tip-tree
  :all-field-list="allFieldList"
  :freq-used-field-list="freqUsedFieldList"
  :get-value-options-fn="getValueOptions"
  :get-tree-obj-by-sql-via-api-fn="getTreeObjBySqlViaApi"
  :aiql-guide="aiqlGuides"
  :is-history-show="true"
  @ai-trans-aiql="handleAiTransClick"
/>

const allFieldList = [{
  id: '1821821109012938753',
  value: 'eventType',
  label: 'Event Type',
  type: 'string',
  desc: 'Event Type',
  isCustom: true,
  isLabel: true,
  isCommon: true,
  isQuery: true,
  isAgg: true
}];

props.allFieldList: FieldListType[] - All available fields array, default []
props.freqUsedFieldList: FieldListType[] - Frequently used fields array, default []
props.dynamicListObj: object - Dynamic list data object, default {}
props.aiqlGuide: AiqlGuideType[] - AIQL syntax guide data, default []
props.disabled: boolean - Disable editing and syntax hints, default false
props.maxRulesCount: number - Maximum condition count limit, default 100
props.maxGroupDepth: number - Maximum group depth limit, default 5
props.isShowValue: boolean - Show field value in display, default false
props.isShowAI: boolean - Enable AI capabilities, default false
props.isAiqlShow: boolean - Show syntax hints, default true
props.isHistoryShow: boolean - Show history records, default false
props.isSupportValueFilter: boolean - Support value search in field selection, default false
props.operatorsConfig: object - Custom operator configuration, default false
props.getValueOptionsFn: (arg: any) => Promise<[success: boolean, data?: any]> - Get field value options, required
props.getTreeObjBySqlViaApiFn: (arg: any) => Promise<[success: boolean, data?: any]> - Expand tree mode function, required
props.getDynamiclistObjDataByEnId: (arg: any) => Promise<[success: boolean, data?: any]> - Expression filter function

events.ai-trans-aiql: (value: any) => void - AI translation to AIQL event

types.FieldListType: Field data object with id, value, label, type, desc, isCustom, isLabel, isCommon, isQuery, isAgg, list properties
types.AiqlGuideType: AIQL syntax guide object with expression, tab, desc, example properties

tips: Component is based on AIQL syntax, ensure backend supports query syntax parsing
getValueOptionsFn and getTreeObjBySqlViaApiFn are required async functions
Field type should match actual data types: string, number, boolean, enum, array
Enum fields need to provide optional value list in list property
Set reasonable maxRulesCount and maxGroupDepth to avoid overly complex queries
AI features require proper configuration and validation
Optimize field and value search performance for large datasets
Component is adapted for dark mode with good visual experience
History records need backend storage for data persistence
Custom operator configuration should match business requirements and ensure syntax correctness

das-table.purpose: Powerful data table component with advanced features for structured data display
das-table.usage: Data lists, report display, data management, and structured information presentation

basic.desc: Basic table with selection, pagination, and column configuration

custom.desc: Table with custom slots and advanced features

props.selection: boolean - Enable row selection, default true
props.rowKey: string|((record: any) => string) - Row key function, default 'id'
props.storageKey: string - Column storage key for persistence
props.refreshIntervals: array - Auto refresh intervals in minutes, default [5, 10, 20]

events.change: (pagination: TablePaginationConfig, filters: any, sorter: any) => void - Table change event
events.expand: (expanded: boolean, record: any) => void - Row expand/collapse event

slots.operate: Operation bar slot - { selectedRowKeys: string[], selectedRows: any[] }
slots.shortcut: Shortcut operation slot - { selectedRowKeys: string[], selectedRows: any[] }
slots.bodyCell: Custom body cell - { column: ColumnType, record: any, index: number }
slots.expand: Custom expand row content - { record: any }

columnProps.title: string - Column header text
columnProps.minWidth: number - Minimum width for resizable columns
columnProps.maxWidth: number - Maximum width for resizable columns
columnProps.fixed: boolean|'left'|'right' - Fixed column position, default false
columnProps.sorter: boolean|((a: any, b: any) => number) - Sort function
columnProps.filters: { text: string, value: string }[] - Filter menu items
columnProps.onFilter: (value: string, record: any) => boolean - Filter function

tips: Use <a-form-item> in #shortcut slot for automatic advanced filtering
a-form-item col property supports 1 or 2 columns only
Column ellipsis is enhanced with tooltip for better text truncation
refreshIntervals uses minutes as unit, default is immediate refresh
Sticky header/pagination depends on parent container CSS properties
Use storageKey to persist column configuration in local storage
resizable columns require number type width for proper dragging
Fixed columns need explicit width to avoid layout issues
Enable virtual scrolling or pagination for large datasets
Use bodyCell slot instead of modifying columns for custom cell content

das-tabs.purpose: Tab component for displaying multiple content panels with navigation switching
das-tabs.usage: Content categorization, navigation switching, and multi-panel content organization

basic.desc: Basic tabs with different styles and positions
basic.code:
Content 1
Content 2

props.modelValue: string|number - Active tab identifier, supports v-model, default ''
props.closable: boolean - Allow closing tabs, default false
props.addable: boolean - Allow adding new tabs, default false
props.editable: boolean - Enable add/close functionality, default false
props.beforeLeave: function - Before tab switch callback, return false to prevent
props.stretch: boolean - Stretch tabs to fill container, default false

events.edit: (targetKey: string, action: 'add'|'remove') => void - Tab edit event

tips: Handle add/close logic properly when using editable, addable, closable properties
beforeLeave callback return value affects tab switching
Combine different type and size for diverse design needs
DasTabPane must be used as child of DasTabs
Tab name should be unique for identification
Handle tab add/remove logic and active tab switching in editable mode
Choose appropriate tab position: top is most common, left/right for vertical layout
Use style types consistently with overall interface design

das-tag-list-view.purpose: Tag list component with tooltip display for space-constrained scenarios
das-tag-list-view.usage: Display multiple tags with truncated view and full list in tooltip when space is limited

basic.desc: Basic tag list with tooltip display
basic.code:
<das-tag-list-view :data-source="tagAllData" />

const tagAllData = [
  { id: 1, tagName: 'Tag 1' },
  { id: 2, tagName: 'Tag 2' },
  { id: 3, tagName: 'Tag 3' },
  { id: 4, tagName: 'Tag 4' }
];

custom.desc: Custom configuration with placement and count display

props.dataSource: Array - Tag data source array, default []
props.max: number - Maximum visible tags count, default 4
props.showLastCount: boolean - Show remaining count instead of ellipsis, default false
props.alterText: string - Placeholder text when no data, default '-'

dataStructure.TagItem: Object with required id (number|string) and tagName (string) properties

tips: Each dataSource object must contain id and tagName properties
When tag count exceeds max, shows ellipsis or count indicator
showLastCount true shows remaining count, false shows ellipsis
placement supports 12 position options for different layouts
alterText sets placeholder text when no data is available
Component automatically handles tag truncation and tooltip display
Set reasonable max value to avoid layout issues with too many tags
Tooltip displays complete tag list for full information access

das-text-ellipsis.purpose: Text ellipsis component for automatically truncating long text with ellipsis display
das-text-ellipsis.usage: Display long text content in limited space with automatic truncation, multi-line support, and tooltip functionality

basic.desc: Basic text ellipsis with single line truncation
basic.code: <das-text-ellipsis text="This is a very long text that will be truncated and display ellipsis when it exceeds the container width" />

multiline.desc: Multi-line text ellipsis with line count control

height.desc: Height-based truncation with precise height control

custom.desc: Custom ellipsis node and link tag

props.text: string - Text content to display, required
props.visibleLine: number - Number of visible lines, default 1
props.visibleHeight: number - Visible height in pixels, priority over visibleLine
props.maxLine: number - Maximum line count, visibleLine cannot exceed this
props.maxHeight: number - Maximum height in pixels, visibleHeight cannot exceed this
props.ellipsis: boolean - Enable text truncation, default true
props.tooltip: boolean - Show tooltip when truncated, default true
props.reflowOnResize: boolean - Responsive text reflow on container resize, default true

events.onReflow: (ellipsis: boolean, result: string) => void - Text reflow completion event

tips: visibleLine cannot exceed maxLine to avoid display issues
visibleHeight cannot exceed maxHeight, set reasonable height parameters
Height truncation has priority over line truncation when both are set
Tag property only supports 'a' and 'span' tags to avoid rendering errors
Container resize automatically recalculates text truncation for responsive effects
English text intelligently recognizes word boundaries to avoid word truncation
Ellipsis automatically displays when truncated, customizable via ellipsisNode slot
Tooltip only shows when text is truncated, not when text fits completely
onReflow event triggers on each text reflow for truncation state monitoring
Component supports responsive layout with automatic adjustment based on container size

das-tool-tip.purpose: Lightweight tooltip component for providing additional information on hover
das-tool-tip.usage: Display brief text information when users hover over elements like buttons, icons, labels, or links

basic.desc: Basic tooltip with default placement and theme

custom.desc: Custom tooltip with arrow and delay settings

props.delay: number - Delay time in milliseconds, default 300
props.showArrow: boolean - Show arrow indicator, default true
props.arrowPointAtCenter: boolean - Arrow points to element center, default false
props.title: string - Tooltip text content (can be customized via title slot)

slots.default: Trigger element that shows tooltip on hover
slots.title: Tooltip content slot

tips: Choose appropriate placement to avoid covering important content
Don't use tooltips for critical information as they are hidden by default
Avoid interactive elements (buttons or links) in tooltips, use popover component instead
Keep text concise and clear, avoid long text that causes line breaks
Set reasonable maximum width, recommended not exceeding 480px
Don't make tooltips too hidden, provide clues for users to expect hints
For labels that need explanation, consider placing an info icon nearby
Suitable for showing button icon names, providing context, displaying truncated text
Set reasonable delay time to avoid affecting user experience
Ensure accurate arrow pointing, choose between edge or center as needed
